column5: First house built on Private Canal back in mid 50s wealthy landowner Cecil Boyt built as his private fishing cabin. House faces intercoastal canal overlooking Eastbay Sievers cut is one of the only openings in to Eastbay also sitting on its own private Canal allowing you to park boatsadjacent to house fishing is great in the front yard which is the intercoastal waterway or under house in private Canal enjoy unbelievable bird activity and be amazed by the Tugs and barges passing within arms length million dollar sunsets daily
